description: Ms. codex. Title from title page (fol. 1a). 25 lines per page. Written in medium small naskh in black ink with use of red. The text is framed within two red lines throughout. Glazed European paper with watermark (vine). On fol. 1a: Several inscriptions, with ownership statements, description of contents, prayer. Modern foliation in pencil using Western numerals. Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the upper cover: "Taṣawwuf 49". Inscription in Arabic script on a label pasted on the pastedown of the upper cover: "Ḥāʼ 1249". Collation: Paper, fol. i, 95, i ; i (blank free endpaper in European glazed paper) + 1-9¹⁰ 10⁴ (+1, fol. 92) + i (blank free endpaper in European glazed paper) ; catchword on the verso of each leaf. Copy completed on a Wednesday in Rabīʻ al-Awwal 1134 by ʻUmar ibn ʻUthmān Ibn ʻUmar ibn ʻAlī Bālī al-Qudsī al-Ḥanafī "khādim naʻāl al-sādat al-ṣūfīyah" (colophon, fol. 95b). Incipit: قال العبد الفقير ... احمد بن محمد بن عبد الكريم ابن عطاء الله الحمد لله الذى فتح لاوليائه باب محبته وانشط نفوسهم من عقال القطيعة ... [2أ] ... اما بعد فانى قصدت فى هذا الكتاب ان اذكر جملاً من فضايل Explicit: فهم خبير القرون ومن هدانا بهم رب العباد من الذنوب [95ب] واحمد ليس يرجو فى معاد سوى جاه النبى لذى الكروب ووالده محمد فاعف عنه ودراكه بلطف من قريب تم الكتاب
author: Ibn ʻAṭāʼ Allāh, Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad, -1309
abstract: Treatise on the spiritual teaching of al-Shaykh Abū al-ʻAbbās al-Mursī and Abū al-Ḥasan al-Shādhilī, comprising ten chapters (bāb) and a conclusion. The conclusion comprises three parts: al-Lāmiʻah al-munīrah wa-al-durrah al-khaṭīrah (fol. 90b) ; al-Waṣīyah al-maktūbah ilá ikhwāninā al-Iskandarīyah (sic, fol. 92a) ; Qaṣīdah (fol. 94a).
extent: i, 95, i leaves: paper ; 212 x 158 (169 x 95) mm. bound to 212 x 165 mm.
